article.headline: Dow's nearly 100-point climb highlighted by gains for IBM, American Express shares
article.body: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is climbing Thursday afternoon with shares of IBM and American Express seeing positive gains for the blue-chip average. Shares of IBM IBM, -2.81% and American Express AXP, +0.26% are contributing to the blue-chip gauge's intraday rally, as the Dow DJIA, +0.56% was most recently trading 96 points higher (0.3%). IBM's shares have gained $7.13 (5.8%) while those of American Express have gained $2.00, or 1.9%, combining for a roughly 60-point boost for the Dow. Also contributing significantly to the gain are Goldman Sachs GS, -0.21%, Travelers TRV, +0.18%, and Coca-Cola KO, +0.69%. A $1 move in any of the benchmark's 30 components equates to a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
